title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cooper University Health Care
Interview Descriptions: Very detailed and professional. Laid back and friendly interviewer. It went very smoothly and made to feel extremely comfortable. I think overall it went very well. Seems like a good company to work for.
Interview Questions: Skills, scheduling conflicts and availability, schooling,

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cooper University Health Care
Interview Descriptions: a little hectic and not thought out. but was a comfortable setting where the interviewers were casual and thoughtful. I was meant to meet with 3 different people but ended up meeting all three at once.
Interview Questions: why do you think you would fit here?

title: Front Desk Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Cooper University Health Care in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Kind and professional interview. Very friendly office staff. Asked good questions and explained the job well. Pretty informal interview but maybe that spoke to the laid back atmosphere. Culture seems very good which is a plus.
Interview Questions: How do you work under pressure?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Cooper University Health Care (Camden, NJ) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: Webex, can’t see the floor until you accept the position, sounded great until I got there and it was a completely different unit. Meeting was a half hour with manager.
Interview Questions: What do you know about cooper

title: Staff Accountant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cooper University Health Care
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very good. Fair questions. If lucky the team will also interview you. The process actually began with a phone interview and then a face to face
Interview Questions:
They asked about prior experience.

Short and long term goals

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Cooper University Health Care (Camden, NJ) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: interview process consisted of phone, then zoom, then in person with various team members. the company culture and structure is very appealing. good questions were asked about how I would approach certain operational issues and their expansion plans.
Interview Questions: How would you approach any patient experience issues?

title: RN Med/Surg Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cooper University Health Care
Interview Descriptions:
Online application 
Email from recruiter gauging your interest in working there and preferred unit
Talked to recruiter on the phone
Got Zoom link for interview
Was told 1-2 weeks I will be contacted with the outcome
Today is 2 weeks and one day
I haven’t heard anything yet
Interview Questions:
The interview consisted of naming strengths and weakness
Tell about a time when you had to navigate a difficult situation 
What interested you about Cooper

title: PSR I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cooper University Health Care (Voorhees, NJ) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: Online and in person interview and tour of office Did and online zoom meeting and then the next step was to tour the office and interview again and meet the staff
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for cooper

title: Critical Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cooper University Health Care
Interview Descriptions: I filled out the application a few months ago didn’t hear anything for a while but when she called I missed it called back and happen a nice conversation HR was nice and made the interview process easy had a second group interview that went well
Interview Questions: What core value will you bring to cooper hospital

title: Director of Operations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Cooper University Health Care (Camden, NJ) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: Video interview during covid was pleasant and informative. Interviewers were engaged and thoughtful in their questions and answers. My questions were answered to my satisfaction, very transparent and did not avoid difficult questions regarding covid or the current state of the position.
Interview Questions: How I handled a particularly difficult patient

title: Registered Nurse Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cooper University Health Care
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by Human Resources then three other leaders (director, manager, physician) in the department. All of my interviews were conducted through FaceTime because of COVID. The interview process went smoothly.
Interview Questions: What type of experience do you have?

title: Critical Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Cooper University Health Care (Camden, NJ) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: Went over my resume. Asked what I would do with a difficult patient/family. Very easy overall they are desperate for people to work there (not a good environment though) it is drama filled but that seems to be the common theme with many hospitals
Interview Questions: What would you do if a patient was upset with the care that they recieved?

title: RN New Grad Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cooper University Health Care
Interview Descriptions: Interview was done virtually. It was an average interview. Typical interview questions regarding why Cooper? Past Work Experiences. Clinical experiences. Overall, my experience was laid back which made it easier for me to get comfortable.
Interview Questions:
If there is a big snow storm, how would you plan on getting to work?
Why Cooper?
Describe a time you didnt get along with a coworker

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Cooper University Health Care in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: Recruiter would call before every interview and ask some questions, if I applied to multiple positions I was asked which ones were highest up in my list. Online video interview process with hiring manager consisted of them asking questions.
Interview Questions: Why Did you choose Cooper?

title: Legal Extern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cooper University Health Care (Camden, NJ) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: Interview with all the legal staff around a meeting table and they each ask you a few questions. Review your resume (everything from top to bottom). Ask about legal health policy and how you know about Cooper Health System.
Interview Questions: About things on your resume.

title: New Grad Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cooper University Health Care (Camden, NJ) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: Interview was virtually (laid back). The interviewer was very informative which was a plus and made me feel comfortable. Interview Lasted about 30 minutes. Got a call 3 weeks later with a offer.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself?
Describe a time you went above and beyond? 
Where do you see your self in 5 years? 
Why Cooper?

title: Critical Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cooper University Health Care (Philadelphia, PA) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: very fast simple easy. highly recommend applying and working for Cooper. they were very kind very easy and seem to really care about employees. i had a very very very great experience
Interview Questions: what was your work history

title: Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cooper University Health Care (Brooklyn, NY) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: Easy and very organized. Hiring manager seemed very genuine. Very thorough process. Great team! I thought it would be pretty intense but they were very welcoming and genuinely trying to get to know me.
Interview Questions: How do I handle pressure?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cooper University Health Care in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: Began process by talking to a recruiter, Video interview first that was reviewed, then a phone interview was set up a week later with nurse director and floor manager
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cooper University Health Care
Interview Descriptions: It was a typical interviewing process. Applied online and then talked to multiple people. Interview questions were average. I found it to be less stressful than most other places I had applied in the past.
Interview Questions: why Cooper?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cooper University Health Care
Interview Descriptions: Easy, quick, in and out process. They asked basic questions and included expectations as well as salary and benefits. I had only one in person interview then was given a job offer.
Interview Questions: How would you get to work if there was a snow storm?

title: PSR I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Cooper University Health Care (Camden, NJ) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: Easy going. Normal questions. Focus on customer service, putting the patient first.   Typical interview with hiring manager and a few peers. Be organized, and. A multi tasker.  Showing you care about the patient experience
Interview Questions: Have you ever had to deal with a difficult patient customer?

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Cooper University Health Care (Camden, NJ) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: Went very well. Typical nursing interview at a hospital in NJ. Prepare for nursing questions and critical thinking questions as well. Interviewers and Human Resources were very nice and straight forward about the position. They also discussed expectations and orientation
Interview Questions: Why did you choose Cooper?

title: Critical Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Cooper University Health Care (Camden, NJ)
Interview Descriptions: AT least 8 weeks.  Initial job fair, email from HR,  call from HR,  over a week of waiting for HR to get back to you . A ling list of things "to do "  in a certain amount of time, and then when you call HR you wait days for a return call or email. then another 2 weeks of things to do and waiting on orientation , another week. Then you finally start , only to find It was not what I thought at all. I was very excited to start this job, and I thought 2 months was worth my time, it turned out , it wasn't , very disappointed in the end.
Interview Questions: What made me want to work at Cooper Hospital

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Cooper University Health Care
Interview Descriptions:
I think the process was a bit different as I was recruited by an outside agency.  Met with the team and was interviewed but it felt more like a conversation. I felt it was awesome to have met the team and given the opportunity to ask questions without their managers in the room.  Only took 1 business day to hear that they wanted to offer the position but probably 2 weeks to get a written offer. 
the following is more about what happened with the onboarding portion. i wish there was more transparency with this because some of it gave me pause but i had already submitted my resignation prior to knowing about the process. 
they required 3 written references via sterling that sends the surveys via email to referees. also background and drug screening is done. they do 2 ppd's one at your work physical (with very limited appointments) and another at orientation. they also test for titers and apparently recommend (require?) vaccinations if you are shown to not be immune to certain diseases. orientation is pretty much an 8hr shift which is pretty redundant unless you are new to the healthcare world.
Interview Questions: Why are you leaving your current job?

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at Cooper University Health Care (Camden, NJ) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied on the jobs website, received phone interview two weeks later from department head, received team interview three weeks later with physician and assistants in the office, received offer the following Monday. Total process about 7 weeks.
Interview Questions: How do you handle stress? And how do you destress at the end of the day?

title: Management Position Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cooper University Health Care
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with the Recruiter First. Then met with the leader.  Was invited back for a third interview with 2 panels: 1-peers and 2-other leaders.  Was very well organized.  I knew exactly what to expect and where to go.
Interview Questions: Behavioral interview questions.  One was what misconception do people have about you?

title: Maintenance Mechanic Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Cooper University Health Care (Camden, NJ) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: A pleasurable experience that was literally a stress free environment. A casual interview consisting of two panel members describing what the job consisted of, requirements, benefits as well as the rest of the process. Seemingly genuine people that enjoy their workplace.
Interview Questions: What made me apply to Cooper?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Cooper University Health Care (Camden, NJ) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with the manager, it was a one on one interview. Asked about my experience as a nurse and my skill set. HR asked questions like why cooper and all those generic questions
Interview Questions: Why cooper over other hospitals

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Cooper University Health Care
Interview Descriptions: Went to a seminar for new dads and received an interview approximately two weeks later. The interview went well, shadowed nurses and spent time on the unit. Was told I should hear back something. Never did. Really enjoyed the floor I shadowed on but was upset about not heating a yay or nay. Yes, I emailed and called. No response.
Interview Questions: Why Cooper?

title: Telephone Operator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cooper University Health Care (Camden, NJ) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied on online about 2 weeks later received a call from the HR Manager for a in person interview. Met with Director of Patient Access she was very friendly.  Took me to the Telecommunications dept to see work environment. Waiting to hear back with a response.
Interview Questions: Why did I apply for the position?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cooper University Health Care
Interview Descriptions: Series of phone calls after emailing various people in the field. After a couple of months, I got an email from a director that set me up with a graduate student. It got my foot in the door.
Interview Questions: What brought you into healthcare?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cooper University Health Care in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: I met with the Nurse Recruiter first, who went over Cooper as a whole, the orientation process, and benefits and pay. We then walked over to the unit where I met the nurse managers and was given a tour before interviewing. Everyone was friendly and professional, and it felt like the process was really about getting to know me as a person. The initial process to get an interview took me a while(about two weeks), but I heard back four days after my interview.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you had a conflict with a peer or coworker and how you handled it

title: Supply Chain Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cooper University Health Care (Camden, NJ) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: the position was described over the telephone, later there was a face to face with the human resource personnel, followed by meeting the manager and a few other panels.
Interview Questions: state your experience?

title: RN, Bsn Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cooper University Health Care (Camden, NJ) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: New graduate interview day, there was long wait, the interview was quick but felt a little rushed, HR asked a few questions, but the nurse manager panel asked the usual, more clinically focused questions
Interview Questions: Met with HR and then a panel of 3 nurse managers

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Cooper University Health Care (Camden, NJ) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions:
In person interviews with relevant teams. Interviews were engaging and open with a wide variety of questions.

Lack of any response after request for an update after weeks of on-site interviews .. does not strike the right tone .. whatever the outcome of the interview.
Interview Questions: Compensation..

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Cooper University Health Care (Camden, NJ) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: Met with the HR recruiter first, then walked a block over to the hospital to meet with the nurse manager and see the unit.  The HR recruiter was very nice and mainly answered questions about benefits and pay. The nurse manager explained the job and expectations in a lot more detail. Everyone was very friendly and appreciative. I was called about a week later with a job offer. Offer contingent upon sucessful completion of a physical, drug screen, and background check.
Interview Questions: I don't remember specific questions exactly, but the nurse manager asked questions that were heavily focused on how I handle stress and adversity. Multi-tasking and time management were also topics of the questions asked.  The HR recruiter asked me more general questions like, "tell me about your prior work history and your clinical experiences" and "what made you want to be a nurse."

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cooper University Health Care (Camden, NJ) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: I had Two interviews, One with the Human Resources office and then one with the manager in the hiring department, both of these two interviews occurred on the same day.
Interview Questions:
Why do I think I am right for the position? 
What can I offer?

title: Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Cooper University Health Care (Camden, NJ) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was quite lengthy. I met with an HR recruiter, the manager of the department, and the director of the department. I was then asked to stay and complete a test. Had I known it was going to be so lengthy, I would have taken an entire day off of work, so it would have been nice to have been told ahead of time. I also did not appreciate their lack of communication. I emailed them a few times to follow up on their decision, and never heard back until about two months later when I got a standard rejection email.
Interview Questions: Director asked what I would do to improve about the organization's social media presence.

title: Business Process Improvment Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Cooper University Health Care (Cherry Hill, NJ) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Pre-face of the INTERVIEW - I interviewed with this Healthcare system over 4 years ago.  It was a LONG interview process that took 8 weeks.   After not hearing anything, I had to contact the HIRING MANAGER, the VP of operations.   He apologized for the issues with their HR department and told me I came in a very close 2nd for the position.   No issue, I thanked them and moved on.   Then in early 2016, last month during a chance meeting I was asked to interview for another position.    

1) Filled out the on-line form and heard nothing back for 2 wks.
2) Emailed the HIRING MANAGER and was told I would get follow up from HR.   
3) Recieved a call NEXT day from HR to schedule a time and would provide confirmation email with directions and time schedule.    No EMAIL Recieved. 
4) Day before Interview, I emailed the manager and he has the HR person forward everything.

Schedule of People (30 mins each & 1 HR with Director):
1) HR Manager
2) Supervisor
3) Manager
4) Director

Day of the interview:
1) I arrive 15 mins early - The secretary can't locate her - I provide phone numbers and information.
The HR person is at Lunch and arrives 40 mins later.  
Very pleasant, but was rushed as we had only 5 mins
2) No Supervisor available, so the Director jumps in. We interview for 1 hour.
3) The Manager comes in.   He had no idea we were interviewings, so I spend 20 mins talking with him.   

No response now for 1 month.   
I recall with my previous experiences with Cooper, that they have many issues with HR and process in general.   This is the only Major hospital in the Philiadephlia area.   Research shows they are loosing money and need Leadership assistance.   Sadly, they still have not found it.
Interview Questions: Standard questions relating to experience and leadership.   How do you work with people and manage issues with change management?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Cooper University Health Care (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Was contacted 2 days later by the unit manager. Arranged for an interview the following week. Met with the unit manager and one of the head nurses. Interview wasn't too bad. Asked to describe the acuity of the patients on the unit I currently work at. Then took a tour of the different units with the head nurse added.
Interview Questions: Describe your most difficult patient

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cooper University Health Care
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, and received an e-mail months later. No correspondence was done over the phone. Everything was scheduled via e-mail. The directions were very clear. I arrived early, and met with a woman from HR first. She was pleasant and very informative. Next, I met with the clinical supervisor for the floor I was interviewing for. She was also very nice, informative, and honest about the job description. I really appreciated that. I left the interview not really knowing if I would get the job or not, and there were several other candidates in the waiting room waiting to be interviewed. I will find out in a few days.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Cooper? Where do you see yourself five years from now? What do you anticipate one of your challenges will be? What will you bring to the floor compared to the other candidates, why should I hire you?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Cooper University Health Care (Camden, NJ) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Medium- difficult interview process. The HR was unsure of the next steps. I was asked to attend a test but no proper information was given in regards to the exam content. No one cared to reach out and let me know the status of my application after the 4-step interview process. The time I invested as a candidate was not respected. Disappointing since I was initially impressed by the Manager and the Organization.
Interview Questions: Situational Questions

title: Insurance Specialist ABS Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cooper University Health Care (Camden, NJ) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: In person interview, lasted about 45-50 minutes. I was impressed at the location of the new office in Camden but at 1st very hesitant because honestly its Camden lol The office was very easy to find and parking ample.
Interview Questions: The HR manager answered typical interview questions, nothing out of the normal. I however did expect more feedback when I was answering so I was unable to get a good feel on how the interview was going

title: Management Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Cooper University Health Care (Camden, NJ) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Met with prospective peers, leaders and key customers during the interview process. It was coordinated all in one day.  Offer was made within one week.  Very streamlined! Thank you for the opportunity.   I recommend arriving early to account for parking and be prepared with an extra updated resume.
Interview Questions: Would I recommend anyone else to interview for a position?

title: Unprofessional Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cooper University Health Care
Interview Descriptions: A Phone screen and in person with two HR women. They seemed like they did not know the exact role they were hiring for or the responsibilities this position would need to tackle. I was open to both. After interview, I followed up  a couple times but never received any feedback. Very unprofessional and disrespectful to the candidate. My time is also important and I hope that they realize that they could also be in this position in future. Treat applicants with respect.
Interview Questions: Very traditional written HR questions. Why should we hire you and other similar such questions.

title: Critical Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Cooper University Health Care (Camden, NJ) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Called in for a interview, asked the basic interview questions and went over the duties and signed a few papers. Lastly the walked me over to the hospital and I had a second interview with the manager of the floor I would be working on. She then showed me around the floor and told me different things I would be doing and then wished me luck. I got a call back a few days later saying congrats you got the job.
Interview Questions: Why did you chose cooper?

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Cooper University Health Care (Camden, NJ) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Ist you have a phone screen, then you interview with the Hiring manager, Then you have an group interview with the Division Heads. If all goes well Cooper Hospital will make an offer.
Interview Questions: What is one of your weakness.

title: Data Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Cooper University Health Care
Interview Descriptions: Interviewer was too busy with other things to pay any attention to me
Interview Questions: Interviews were not challenging

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Cooper University Health Care in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Typical tell me about yourself, why are you looking, behavioral questions. Give examples of how your handled things in previous jobs. Be sure to tell them how much you love Cooper and what an honor it would be to become a part of their organization. They love praise.
Interview Questions: Why are you looking for a job

title: Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cooper University Health Care (Camden, NJ) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very thorough regarding details of employment. Answered all questions in a straight forward manner.
Interview Questions: Any trepidation regarding the responsibilities set forth for the position

title: Administrative Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cooper University Health Care (Camden, NJ) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Online application, In person with HR representative and final interview was withHiring/department manager.  Straight forward behavioral type questions at first.  Got more specific with questions about particular departments and area of interest.
Interview Questions: What are the challenges in your view of urban health system

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Cooper University Health Care (Camden, NJ) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview happened in three different stages. First phone, then live with HR and finally withe the hiring manager. The fourth and final process was a group interview with staff.
Interview Questions: average basic interview questions that I cannot remember

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Cooper University Health Care (Cherry Hill, NJ) in Oct 2010
Interview Descriptions: An e-mail was sent followed up with a phone call to set a time and date for the one - to - one interview.  I arrived to the HR office, the temperature must have been 90 plus degrees inside and 27 degrees outside. Filling out the application followed by an interview with the recruiter.  We reviewed my daily activities and how the would work in the HR department.  Then the pay rate topic was discussed and I left with the recruiter stating she would see if the offer could be increased.   I received a letter stating the position was filled internally.
Interview Questions: State your daily work process
